div.p: Box 251/3, Shillinglaw papers, La Trobe Australian manuscripts collection, State Library of Victoria, Melbourne.
MS annotation by Shillinglaw: 'Recd 1.VI.87', 'Answered 1.VI.87 to Mr McDonald'. 31/5/87

It has been suggested to me, my dear friend, by Mr Macdonald,
Alexander Cameron Macdonald. that I should set your genius again into motion, by you writing for our next geogr. meeting
The Victorian Branch of the Royal Geographical Society of Australasia. an appeal for sending Mr Giles again into Central Australia.
Giles had offered to lead such a party gratuitously, if it could be equipped. The proposal was discussed at the meeting of the Branch held in 9 August 1887 (Argus, 11 August 1887, p. 5); Giles was present at the meeting.

If you will do this, I shall be greatly pleased. When yesterday waiting with Mr Cuthbertson on the Governor,
Henry Brougham Loch. The Victorian Branch of the Royal Geographical Society of Australia had just contracted with Cuthbertson to explore the Owen Stanley Range in New Guinea; see M to W. Cuthbertson, 28 May 1885. Loch attended some meetings of the Branch and occasionally chaired meetings on special topics. I had occasion to enlisten Lieut Officer's
Aide-de-camp to the Governor. interest in this enterprise, and he promised to advocate subscribing among his Toorack-friends.
Toorak, an upper-class suburb of Melbourne. If we could get £400 or £500 together, no subscriptions less than £10 should be accepted Mr Giles could start probably with a few companions, as the rail takes them already to Hergotts Spring.
Hergott Springs, now Marree, SA. The South Austr. & West. Austr Governments would be sure, to give something for his mapping of their respective territories after Giles return.
